title: Storing, Sharing & Automation
overview: This section focuses on storing data securely, sharing it effectively with others, and automating repetitive tasks to save time. These practices improve efficiency and consistency and are highly valued in data roles. They also contribute to the Approach to Work and Technical Skills elements of Assessment Method 1.

skills: Save files in appropriate formats (CSV, XLSX, PDF)
Organise folders and file naming conventions
Share spreadsheets via cloud platforms like OneDrive or Google Drive
levels.task: Save a completed report as XLSX and PDF. Upload to a shared folder and ensure naming follows the company standard.

skills: Use named ranges and structured tables for reusability
Apply data validation and formulas that auto-update
Link data across sheets and files
levels.task: Create a named table that links to a summary sheet. Use formulas that auto-update when new rows are added.

skills: Create and run macros for repetitive tasks
Use Power Query to automate data transformation
Design a reusable dashboard with refreshable data
levels.task: Record a macro that formats a report and creates a chart. Import data using Power Query and build a refreshable dashboard layout.

dataSource.name: Training workbook samples
dataSource.note: These workbooks are designed for automation and sharing practice. They are fictional but represent common data formats in the workplace.
